title: In Bihar, a matter of life and debt
content: In Bihar, increased borrowing from multiple sources, both institutional and informal lenders, has led to excessive debt burdens. Borrowers struggle to repay loans with high interest rates while dreading recovery agents, who intimidate and harass them. Sobhana K. Nair and T.C.A. Sharad Raghavan report on the lack of political thrust on bringing in any regulatory mechanism in the State that is set to go to the polls later this year

title: Draft data protection rules have received almost 7,000 comments: IT Ministry
content: Comments will not be released publicly, to allow for candid submissions; the Rules, needed to enforce the 2023 Digital Personal Data Protection Act, are yet to be notified seven months after the draft was published

title: Modi government aided OBCs, Congress opposed reservations: Education Minister Pradhan
content: Congress leaders from Pandit Nehru to Rajiv Gandhi opposed reservations, says Dharmendra Pradhan; says it was Modi government which brought in SC, ST, OBC reservations in teaching posts in higher education

title: "Centuries Old Relations, Key In Neighbourhood 1st Policy": PM On India-Maldives Ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday expressed gratitude and reaffirmed the close ties between India and the Maldives during an official banquet hosted in his honour by Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu in Male.

title: IRCTC Got Over 6,000 Complaints On Poor Food Quality In 2024-25: Minister
content: In 2024-25, 6,645 complaints related to poor quality of food were reported by passengers, out of which in 1,341 cases fines were imposed on the food suppliers, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said in a written reply in the Rajya Sabha on Friday.

title: 2 Class 10 Students Found Pregnant In State-Run-Hostels In Odisha
content: Adding to the growing concern over sexual exploitation of women in Odisha, two minor girls  both students of Class 10 and residents of state-run hostels in Kandhamal district  were found to be pregnant during routine health checkups, police said.

title: 'Why Isn't He Paying?' Trump's Golf Visit To Cost Scottish Taxpayers
content: It may not be typical golf attire, but one of the most ubiquitous outfits seen on US President Donald Trump 's golf course Friday ahead of his visit was the reflective yellow vest worn by Scottish police.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Epstein Survivor Recalls How Ghislaine Maxwell Lured Girls Into His Home
content: US Attorney General Pam Bondi told President Donald Trump in May that his name appeared in investigative files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The appearance of his name in the files has raged a political war in the MAGA world.

title: Man Detained For Sexual Assault Of 10-Year-Old Girl In Tamil Nadu
content: Making a breakthrough, police in Tamil Nadu have detained a man from West Bengal who is suspected to be behind the sexual assault of a 10-year-old girl in Tiruvallur district.

title: Trump's Trip To Scotland As His New Golf Course Opens Blurs Politics, Family's Business
content: Lashed by cold winds and overlooking choppy, steel-gray North Sea waters, the breathtaking sand dunes of Scotland's northeastern coast rank among Donald Trump's favorite spots on earth.

title: "Don't Play With Fire": MK Stalin Slams Poll Roll Revision In Bihar
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister and DMK President MK Stalin has come out strongly against the Election Commission of India's (EC) ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar, calling it a dangerous attempt to "engineer outcomes".

title: Student Takes Raj Thackeray's Name, Asks Others To Speak In Marathi, Thrashed
content: A student was allegedly beaten up outside a college in Navi Mumbai for - in a semi-threatening tone - asking others to speak in Marathi in a WhatsApp group.

title: As Delhi's Water Bills Dues Cross Rs 1.4 Lakh Crore, Who Owes What?
content: Over Rs 1.4 lakh crore in pending water bills has accumulated at the Delhi Jal Board (DJB), officials have said.

title: Nagaland Turns Back 200 Vehicles Carrying Illegal Migrants From Assam Border
content: The Niuland district administration along with the Nagaland Police and the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) intercepted and turned back over 200 vehicles carrying evicted illegal immigrants from Assam at various checkpoints across the district.

title: Saif Ali Khan Stabbing Case: Mumbai Police Opposes Attacker's Bail Plea
content: The Mumbai Police have opposed the bail application of Bangladeshi national identified as Mohammad Shariful Islam, who allegedly stabbed Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan at his Mumbai residence in January this year.

title: Tropical Storm Co-May Adds To Philippines' Deadly Week, Forcing 278,000 Evacuations
content: A tropical storm was blowing across the Philippines' mountainous north Friday, worsening more than a week of bad weather that has caused at least 25 deaths and prompted evacuations in villages hit by flooding and landslides.

title: "50-50 Or Less": Trump On Possibility Of European Union Trade Deal
content: US President Donald Trump estimated Friday there was a 50 percent chance of Washington being able to strike a deal with the European Union to reduce import tariffs.

title: PM Modi Becomes India's 2nd-Longest Serving PM, Felicitated in Maldives
content: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu on Friday extended heartfelt congratulations to the visiting Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, lauding his achievement as India's second-longest-serving PM in consecutive terms.

title: Gaza Ceasefire Talks Expected To Resume Next Week, Says Hamas
content: Ceasefire talks between Hamas and Israel are expected to resume next week, a Hamas official said Friday, as Israeli strikes continue across Gaza and experts warn Palestinians are on the brink of famine.

title: Odisha Man Charged For Acid Attack On 4 Cows Outside House: Cops
content: A man was booked in Odisha's Ganjam district for allegedly throwing acid at four cows that were grazing outside his house, police said on Friday.

title: Over 80% of Rural Indian Families Now Have Access to Piped Drinking Water
content: Marking a significant achievement in rural water infrastructure, the Centre's flagship initiative, Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) - Har Ghar Jal, has reached a key milestone.

title: Video: Trump, Federal Reserve Chief Argue On Live TV Over Cost Of Building Renovation
content: After criticising Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell everywhere - on social media and in front of reporters, US President Donald Trump landed at the Fed's front door.

title: Governor Returns Aparajita Bill To Bengal Government, Trinamool May Protest
content: West Bengal Governor CV Ananda Bose has sent back the Aparajita Women and Child (West Bengal Criminal Laws Amendment) Bill, 2024 to the state government.

title: Chief of Integrated Defence Staff to witness multilateral exercise Talisman Sabre 2025 in Australia
content: Six officers from Indian Armed Forces are participating in TS25 as staff planners at various levels of joint operations planning, control, safety and logistics. Indian officers have earlier participated in 2021 and 2023 as observers

title: UPSC debars candidate for three years for possession of incriminating material

content: Phone survey of migrant workers from the State was conducted by the Stranded Workers Action Network (SWAN); study says the workers are most susceptible to documentation deficits

content: The police came to know about the escape upon finding a makeshift rope dangling over the jail wall. Tip-offs from two local people enable police to trace the convict to a well in compound 3 km from the jail.

content: Officials say this plan will allow motorists to pay only for the distance they travel, instead of bearing the full toll cost.¬†

title: Caught in crackdown against illegal immigrants, two Assam residents recall perilous trip across the border
content: Hands, eyes tied, asked to urinate in plastic bags, given a few hundred takas and abandoned across the border, the residents say after returning home from their ordeal. They recalled that the only thing district officials had to say after this was that it was a ‚Äòmistake‚Äô and that they should not ‚Äòthink too much about it‚Äô.

content: Inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2022, the medical with a 700-bed hospital has 113 vacancies spread across all departments, according to sources

title: Reducing pass percentage in Class X exams draws mixed reactions
content: The State government on Thursday issued a gazette notification reducing the pass percentage for SSLC exams from 35 to 33.

title: Bihar SIR: Almost 66 lakh voters may not make it to draft electoral roll
content: Forms of 7.23 crore electors have been received and digitised, and all their names will be published in the draft roll on August 1; any claims of wrongful exclusion or inclusion can be filed by September 1

content: Around 11,760 ballot units and 4,700 control units to be checked; first phase of scrutiny to be completed before August 25 as directed by State Election Commission

title: Over 6,000 people from Chennai and its peripheral areas receive pattas
content: As there were some challenges in issuing the pattas in these areas, the T.N. government had constituted a committee to look into them

title: India aware of China's aim to become 'maritime power', closely monitors developments in IOR: Centre
content: China also has a naval and maritime presence in the Indian Ocean Region, including through anti-piracy escort missions, port calls and deployment of research and survey vessels, the MoS said

title: Govindachamy‚Äôs escape exposes cracks in high-security prisons in Kerala
content: Though govt. had proposed to erect electric fencing and install laser-scanning systems at all jails, these are yet to be implemented in several jails, including the Kannur Central Prison

title: Kerala mulling credits, semester system for higher secondary classes

title: Expert picks, best bets: How can Whittaker bounce back vs. de Ridder at UFC Fight Night?
content: Reinier de Ridder claims a second-round TKO to give bo Nickal his first career UFC loss . the pair will host their first of two 2025 fight cards in Abu Dhabi this weekend . he suffered a first-round submission loss against Khamzat Chimaev in his last Octagon appearance .

title: NHL Power Rankings: Summer storylines for all 32 teams
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on how strong each team will be in the 2025-26 season . this edition includes the top storyline for each team during the summer break, which generates our master list .

title: The Gy√∂keres-to-Arsenal saga finally looks close to ending. What took so long?
content: arsenal are in a bad spot amid a transfer standoff with Sporting CP for Viktor Gy√∂keres . the striker's name is still looming over the club's preseason tour to Asia and he isn't even a Gunner yet . he'll shock everyone after an arsenal fan event at an Irish bar .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: Power Rankings: A red-hot NL team surges up to debut at No. 1
content: a new team atop our power rankings after the first week of the second half . the Brewers were the biggest riser in Week 17 going from No. 9 in our final rankings before the All-Star break to No. 1 . in the American League, the Tigers have been overtaken by the Astros and Blue Jays .

content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: cristiano ronaldo scores the winning penalty in the 118th minute . the 19-year-old striker has become an "agent of chaos" who has salvaged the Lionesses campaign with late goals . she struck the equalizer in the quarterfinal against Sweden to make it 2-2 .

title: MLB trade grades: How much do Friday's trades help Yankees, Mets?
content: alden Gonzalez breaks down the Mariners trading for Josh Naylor and the latest with the Diamondbacks and Eugenio Suarez . this is your one-stop shop for grades and analysis breaking down the details for every trade as they go down .

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team
content: Supercell has announced that it has partnered with Travis Hunter for the summer jam . the event is designed to help players get their villages back into shape . Hunter is a highly respected athlete, but also an active Clash of Clans player . it is set to last until Aug. 1 .

title: How Jen Welter‚Äôs hiring by the Cardinals has changed the NFL landscape for women
content: a decade ago, when she was 12, she was her first love . her father, former Div. III player Lawyer Wilson, Jr., taught her the game . she is entering her second season as an assistant coach with the Buffalo Bills .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Residents demand measures to negate human-elephant interactions in Gudalur
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: India-UK FTA: Indian liquor cos allege discrimination against homegrown brands - Details
content: Indian alcohol companies are unhappy with the UK trade policies. They allege unfair trade practices. UK's norms create barriers for Indian brands. These norms impact sales. Confederation of Indian Alcoholic Beverage Companies seeks government intervention. They want fair access to the UK market. The goal is to achieve $1 billion in exports by 2030.

title: Governor returns Bengal rape bill after Centre flags concerns
content: West Bengal Governor C V Ananda Bose sent back the Aparajita bill. The reason is objections from the central government. The Centre believes the bill proposes excessively harsh punishments for rape. The bill suggests life imprisonment or capital punishment for rape. The Centre also opposed removing stricter penalties for sexual assault of minors.

title: Be patriots, speak up for domestic issues instead of Gaza: HC to CPM
content: The Bombay High Court dismissed a petition by the Communist Party of India (Marxist) challenging the police's denial of permission for a Gaza protest at Azad Maidan. The court questioned the party's legal standing and suggested focusing on domestic issues instead. The state opposed the plea, citing potential law and order problems and conflict with India's stance.

title: ‚ÄòNever‚Äô: Trump denies being told his name was in Epstein files; downplays case as ‚Äònot a big thing‚Äô
content: Donald Trump denied being briefed about his name appearing in Jeffrey Epstein's files, contradicting a Wall Street Journal report. He dismissed questions about Ghislaine Maxwell's interview and a potential pardon, stating it's not the right time. Trump shifted focus to others associated with Epstein, accusing the media of exaggerating his involvement.

title: Bill Gates' daughter asks if he‚Äôd be willing to work a shift in customer service
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: Rajnath to initiate debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha on Monday
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is scheduled to initiate a discussion on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, with PM Modi expected to intervene. This debate aims to address concerns surrounding alleged intelligence failures and US President Trump's ceasefire claims. The government has expressed readiness to discuss all issues, including the Pahalgam attack, seeking to restore normalcy to Parliament after disruptions.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up: 'He was trying to leave us'; felt abandoned during Wade‚Äôs cancer battle
content: Gabrielle Union revealed her initial "selfish" feelings during Dwyane Wade's cancer battle, fearing she'd be left to raise their children alone. This led to distrust due to Wade's secrecy surrounding his treatment. Thankfully, Wade overcame the disease, and the couple is now focused on family, enjoying time with their daughter Kaavia and Wade's other children.

title: 100s expelled to Bangladesh sans due process: HRW
content: Human Rights Watch accuses Indian authorities of expelling hundreds of ethnic Bengali Muslims to Bangladesh, alleging they are illegal immigrants. HRW claims many are Indian citizens and the expulsions are ongoing without due process. The rights body urges India to halt deportations and ensure procedural safeguards against arbitrary detention and expulsion.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I‚Äôve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: 4 bids made by BJP-JDU people to kill Tejashwi, claims Rabri
content: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi has alleged that there have been four attempts to assassinate her son, Tejashwi Prasad Yadav, blaming BJP-JD(U) members. She claims these attempts occurred on the road and conspiracies are still being hatched in Patna. These allegations follow recent incidents involving Tejashwi's security, including a speeding car, a drone crash, and a truck hitting his convoy.

title: J&K an exception, no delimitation exercise prior to 2026 Census: SC
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that delimitation exercises for states, excluding Jammu and Kashmir, must wait until the publication of census data after 2026, as mandated by Article 170(3) of the Constitution. The court dismissed a petition seeking immediate delimitation for Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, emphasizing that the constitutional provisions do not apply to Union Territories like J&K.

title: Opposition paralyses House again over Bihar rolls
content: Parliament proceedings faced disruptions for the fifth day due to opposition demands for a discussion on alleged electoral roll irregularities in Bihar. Despite government assurances of readiness for discussion, protests escalated, with opposition MPs tearing symbolic representations of the issue. The BJP criticized the opposition for neglecting important matters, including private members' bills and a bill concerning Scheduled Tribes.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots were coming to take our jobs, you would ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: 99.8% of Bihar voters turned in forms before deadline: EC
content: In Bihar, over 7.2 crore electors actively participated in the special intensive revision process, submitting their signed enumeration forms before the deadline, securing their place in the draft electoral roll to be published on August 1. The Election Commission digitized these forms, acknowledging the efforts of various officials and political parties.

title: 'My mistake that caste census was not done in UPA tenure': Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi admitted his mistake in not conducting a caste census during the UPA government, taking personal responsibility for the oversight. He highlighted the Congress-ruled Telangana's census as a model for social data collection. Gandhi urged OBCs to assume leadership roles within the Congress, while also dismissing PM Modi as lacking substance and being overhyped by the media.

title: Congress has been anti-quota for generations: BJP's Dharmendra Pradhan
content: BJP has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's regret over the UPA's failure to conduct a caste census, labeling it a deceptive tactic to conceal the Congress party's inherent bias. Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan criticized the Congress's historical treatment of Dalit leaders and accused Rahul Gandhi of spreading falsehoods regarding vacant reserved posts in central universities.

title: Ciara and baby Amora twin in sweet snap: Fans gush over cuteness
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson's daughter, Amora Princess, is growing up. A recent photo shows Amora resembles her father, Russell Wilson. The family celebrated milestones, including Sienna's birthday and their 9th anniversary. Russell Wilson transitioned to the New York Giants. Ciara shares glimpses of Amora. The Wilsons balance family, fame, and football. They co-parent Future with unity.

title: YesJulz breaks silence: 'Leave me out of it'; LeBron slammed for dancing to Kendrick‚Äôs Drake diss
content: LeBron James ignited controversy by dancing to Kendrick Lamar's Drake diss track in Cannes, drawing social media influencer YesJulz into the fray. Years after infidelity rumors involving James surfaced, YesJulz has now broken her silence, posting "Leave me out of it" on X. The rumors began in 2014 when James played for the Miami Heat.

title: Who is Sky Daily? Hulk Hogan‚Äôs wife sparks curiosity; age gap, love story & wedding revealed
content: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, married Sky Daily in September 2023, marking his third marriage. Their relationship, which began in 2022, has drawn attention due to their 25-year age gap. Despite family drama involving Hogan's ex-wife and daughter, the couple remains focused on their shared faith and fitness, solidifying their bond.

title: Government blocks 25 OTT platforms for obscenity
content: The Indian government has blocked 25 OTT platforms, including Ullu and ALTT, along with associated websites and apps, due to sexually explicit and obscene content. This action follows warnings and consultations with various ministries and organizations, triggered by public grievances and violations of IT Rules and obscenity laws. The move is praised by some as a necessary step to protect cultural values.

title: Two years on, Imran Khan's sons step in as protest call rattles Islamabad
content: As Imran Khan marks two years in jail, his sons are lobbying in the US for his release, coinciding with Khan's call for nationwide protests. Khan faces convictions in multiple cases, which PTI alleges are politically motivated. With PTI leadership weakened, the state is cracking down, sentencing party leaders amidst a fractured political landscape and accusations against the army chief.

title: Counterfeit crisis: J&K govt bans machine-made products from handicrafts showrooms
content: The J&K government is cracking down on Kashmiri handicraft dealers who are misrepresenting machine-made products as authentic, handmade items. Notices have been issued, threatening blacklisting for those who fail to remove the fake goods. This action follows complaints and the deregistration of a retailer for selling a machine-made carpet as a genuine, GI-certified Kashmiri handicraft, aiming to protect the region's artisan legacy.

title: ‚ÄòBill Clinton, former Harvard president: Trump says he‚Äôll share list of Epstein associates
content: Donald Trump dismissed questions regarding a potential Ghislaine Maxwell pardon, instead urging focus on figures like Bill Clinton and a former Harvard officials linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. Trump's comments coincided with Maxwell's questioning and followed speculation about an alleged Epstein client list. Despite past ties with Epstein, Trump faces pressure to address the matter as public interest in Epstein's associates persists.

title: Girl fights leukemia for 22 months, returns to IIM-L to finish course
content: Anjali Bharti, a 28-year-old IIM Lucknow student, has returned to her studies after a two-year hiatus, triumphing over stage III leukaemia. Diagnosed shortly after joining IIML in 2022, she underwent extensive treatment, including chemotherapy and a bone marrow transplant, with her brother Ashish as her donor. Supported by her family, friends, and the IIML community, Anjali's resilience serves as an inspiration to others.

title: ‚ÄòDrug peddler‚Äô killed in Jammu crossfire, kin cry foul
content: A suspected drug peddler, Parvez Ahmed, died in an exchange of fire with police in Jammu, prompting allegations of a staged encounter from his family. Protests erupted, leading to the suspension of two District Special Branch personnel and the launch of a departmental inquiry. An SIT has been formed to investigate the incident following demands for a swift probe from political figures like Omar Abdullah and Mehbooba Mufti.

title: Brock Purdy‚Äôs baby news leaked: 49ers star blindsided; did teammate go too far?
content: San Francisco 49ers backup tight end Mason Pline ignited controversy by revealing that Brock Purdy and his wife Jenna are expecting a baby during an interview. This unexpected announcement occurred without the Purdys' prior consent, potentially breaching their privacy. The incident has sparked debate regarding locker room loyalty and professional boundaries within the team.

title: Arjun Kapoor once said he put loved ones before himself
content: Arjun Kapoor, in a throwback episode of Koffee With Karan, shared insights into his relationship with Malaika Arora, emphasizing the careful consideration given to making their bond public. He prioritized his loved ones, especially Malaika's son, and approached the relationship with sensitivity. Arjun highlighted the mutual understanding and support they shared, acknowledging how their shared industry background strengthened their connection.

title: Purge, paranoia, and power: Inside China's black box - Is Xi Jinping losing control?
content: Despite persistent rumors and high-profile purges, Xi Jinping remains firmly in control of China, though his rule increasingly relies on loyalty over performance. Cracks are emerging within the military and economy, fueling speculation about potential instability. With no clear successor in sight, Xi's long-term grip on power faces mounting challenges and uncertainty.

title: Monsoon mayhem: Only thunder, no talk - a quick recap of Week 1 of Parliament that ended in washout
content: Parliament's Monsoon Session began turbulently, marked by adjournments and political clashes. New members were sworn in amidst uproar over national security and electoral roll revisions. A rare bipartisan impeachment motion against a judge and a resignation added to the drama. Despite disruptions, consensus emerged for a special debate on Operation Sindoor, scheduled to begin next week.

title: Bengaluru | M Chinnaswamy Stadium 'unsuitable' for large-scale events: Commission
content: Following a tragic stampede during RCB's IPL victory celebrations that led to 11 fatalities, the M Chinnaswamy stadium has been deemed unsafe for large events. A commission report criticised the stadium's design and indicted RCB, DNA Entertainment, and the KSCA.

title: India‚Äôs day of drift: Flat body language, flatter tactics at Old Trafford
content: India's Day 3 at Old Trafford was marred by tactical errors and a listless bowling performance. Captain Shubman Gill's questionable decisions, including under-bowling Shardul Thakur and delaying Washington Sundar's introduction, allowed England to dominate. At close, England were ahead by 186 runs.

title: 'They want to die': Trump blames Hamas for failed Gaza peace talks
content: Donald Trump stated that Hamas was unwilling to negotiate a ceasefire and hostage release, asserting they lack bargaining power and "want to die." He indicated that Hamas leaders will be pursued. President Trump dismissed the significance of France's recognition of a Palestinian state, while acknowledging Macron as "a good guy.

title: US-EU trade deal talks: Trump sees ‚Äò50/50 chance‚Äô as August 1 tariff deadline nears
content: US President Trump stated a ‚Äú50/50 chance‚Äù of securing a trade agreement with the EU to lower import tariffs, with an August 1 deadline looming. While the EU approved a $109 billion retaliatory package, Trump threatened 30% tariffs on EU exports if no deal is signed. Negotiations with Canada have stalled, and a 35% tariff is possible.

title: PM Modi-Muizzu talks: From 'India Out' to all in for FTA - how tides turned in the Indian Ocean
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Muizzu met to improve India-Maldives relations after a period of strain caused by the "India Out" campaign and diplomatic disputes. Discussions covered trade, defence, and infrastructure, with India handing over vehicles to the Maldives.

title: 'Could develop into war ...': Thailand issues warning; martial law in 8 areas bordering Cambodia
content: Escalating violence along the Thailand-Cambodia border has resulted in casualties and mass displacement, prompting international concern. The conflict, rooted in colonial-era border disputes, intensified with deadly attacks and military mobilization. Diplomatic efforts are underway as global powers urge de-escalation and protection of civilians amidst rising tensions and accusations of war crimes.

title: Watch: 'Won't see her for 2 months' KL Rahul gets emotional as he talks about missing daughter
content: KL Rahul, currently in England for the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, is experiencing the challenges of being away from his newborn daughter, Evaarah Vipula Rahul, born in March. Rahul shared his feelings with Cheteshwar Pujara, expressing the joy his daughter has brought and the difficulty of balancing professional commitments with family life.

title: Bihar SIR: 22L dead, 7L duplicate voters - what EC has found after '99.8% coverage'
content: Bihar's Election Commission reports 99.8% voter coverage under the special intensive revision, digitizing over 7.23 crore forms for publication by August 1, 2025. The cleanup identified 22 lakh deceased voters and other discrepancies, shared with political parties for review. Despite opposition criticism, the CEC defends the process, inviting public input for corrections.

title: Visit turns awkward: Fed Chair publicly fact-checks Trump - Watch
content: During a tour of the Federal Reserve, President Trump publicly clashed with Chair Jerome Powell over renovation costs, alleging a $3.1 billion overrun. Powell refuted the claim, clarifying that Trump was including a separate, completed building in the calculation. Despite Powell's explanation, Trump maintained his stance and criticized the Fed's interest rate policy, while White House officials downplayed the dispute.

title: Jordan Hicks announces retirement at 33 after Cleveland Browns training camp absence
content: Jordan Hicks, the Cleveland Browns linebacker, has retired from the NFL. He made the announcement on Instagram. Hicks missed training camp due to a personal matter. He played for ten seasons. He thanked football for the lessons learned. His retirement leaves a gap in the Browns' defense. The team will rely on younger players.

title: IND vs ENG 4th Test: Bumrah, Siraj limp off the field, India's worries deepen
content: India faced a setback on Day 3 of the fourth Test against England as key bowlers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj both struggled physically. Bumrah struggled with his left ankle after bowling just one over with the new ball, while Siraj also limped off during his 22nd over.

title: Kishore Kumar had heart attack after son Amit's wedding was called off
content: Amit Kumar revealed that his called-off wedding in 1981 deeply affected Kishore Kumar, leading to his first heart attack. Kishore had planned a grand celebration in Kolkata and envisioned settling down with Amit. However, the discovery that the bride was already married shattered his plans.

title: Why MAGA thinks Trump is the Epstein whistleblower
content: The myth appears to originate from a 2018 book‚ÄîFire and Fury by journalist Michael Wolff‚Äîwhich recounts a falling out between Trump and Epstein over a Palm Beach real estate deal. In Wolff‚Äôs telling, Trump outbid Epstein for a mansion and then refused to sell it to him, souring their relationship.

title: Josh Allen reacts as sister Nicala launches baby line with No. 17 twist
content: Josh Allen's sister, Nicala Madden, launched a baby clothing line called Little Dreamers Co., featuring a special collection named "17 Sideline Snuggles" as a tribute to Allen's jersey number. The Buffalo Bills quarterback expressed his pride and support for his sister's new venture.
